page.title: 06EDUCATION AROUND WILLINGDON
page.content: Several similarities exist between the schools in this area showing a uniform approach to education. The school day still begins with an assembly.Much importance is attached to home/school liaison as is shown by the fact that all schools except the Infant and special schools send home written reports and all schools give parents regular opportunities to meet the staff to discuss their child's educational progress. All schools except Lindfield have a uniform, although wearing it is optional at Willingdon Trees. Formal testing is carried out at all schools, except the Infant and Special Schools. Every school has its own games field and a computer is now a common element in a teacher's resources. Only one school has its own swimming pool.
